product_type.value: Non-Linked Non-Participating Individual Pure Risk Premium Life Insurance Plan
product_type.description: Type of the insurance product (e.g., Term, ULIP, Endowment)

distribution_channel.description: Distribution channel for the product (e.g., Online, Offline, Online and Offline, Agent)

plan_options.value:
1. **Plan Options**: There are three Plan options available that offer fixed term cover until the age of 99 years. A customer can choose one based on their protection needs.

2. **Death Benefit**: Under this plan option, the **Sum Assured on Death** will be paid upon the death of the Life Assured or Spouse during the Policy Term, provided the Policy is in-force at the time of death.

3. **Coverage**: Both the Life Assured and the Spouse can be covered for the term of the contract, subject to the terms and conditions of the Policy.

4. **Monthly Survival Income**: A **Monthly Survival Income** will be payable at the beginning of each month starting from the Policy Anniversary coinciding with or following the Life Assured attaining age 60 years, continuing until the end of the Policy Term or the death of the Life Assured, whichever occurs first.

5. **Policy Term**: The maximum maturity age is 99 years (80 years for Single Premium or for a Non-Working Spouse). The policy terminates on the Policy Anniversary coinciding with or immediately after the 99th birthday of the Life Assured if a Policy Term of up to 99 years is opted. If optional covers like ADB/TI/ATPD PP/ATPD PPP are opted, the maximum maturity of the base plan and these optional covers will be 75 years.

terminal_illness_benefits.value:
1. In case of **diagnosis of Terminal Illness (TI)**, a lump sum benefit shall be paid immediately, up to a maximum of ₹2 Crores.

2. This is a **100% accelerated benefit**, meaning that the amount paid under the TI benefit will reduce the **Death Benefit** amount by the same amount.

3. Upon diagnosis of TI during the **Policy Term**, all other **Optional In-built Covers** and their corresponding premiums will cease immediately, and the policy will continue for the remaining **Death Benefit** only, subject to payment of premiums for the base **Death Benefit** as due.

4. The TI benefit can only be opted with **Life Secure** and **Life Secure with Return of Premium** plan options.

5. The **TI Sum Assured** shall be the same as the **Sum Assured**, subject to a maximum of ₹2,00,00,000 for the **Life Assured/Working Spouse** (as applicable).

6. The **TI benefit amount** is payable only once during the **Policy Term** for the **Life Assured/Working Spouse** (as applicable).

7. No **TI benefit** is payable if the **Policy/insurance coverage** is in lapsed status.
terminal_illness_benefits.description: Details regarding the Terminal Illness benefits under the iSelect Smart360 Term Plan.
chunks:

In case of diagnosis of Terminal Illness, lump sum beneﬁt up to maximum of Rs. 2 Crores shall be paid immediately. This
is a 100% accelerated beneﬁt. Hence on payment of TI beneﬁt, Death Beneﬁt amount shall be reduced to the extent of

sponding premiums will cease immediately and Policy shall con�nue for remaining Death Beneﬁt only subject to
payment of premiums for base Death Beneﬁt as and when due.
This beneﬁt can be opted with Life Secure and Life Secure with Return of Premium plan op�ons only.

other_benefits.value:
1. **Optional In-Built Covers** available in the iSelect Smart360 Term Plan include:

 a. **Accidental Death Benefit (ADB)**: In the event of death due to an accident, the applicable Sum Assured on Death plus the ADB Sum Assured will be paid, and the policy will terminate.

 b. **Accidental Total & Permanent Disability (ATPD) Premium Protection**: If the insured suffers from Accidental Total & Permanent Disability, all future premiums will be waived, and all other coverages will continue for the remaining policy term as an in-force policy.

 c. **Accidental Total & Permanent Disability (ATPD) Premium Protection Plus**: Details on this cover are not provided in the document.

2. **Child Care Benefit (CCB)**: This benefit can be added within one year of the birth or legal adoption of the first child of the Life Assured or Working Spouse, provided no children were present at policy inception. However, it is only available with the **Life Secure** plan option.

3. **Block Your Premium (BYP)**: This option is also only available with the **Life Secure** plan option.

4. **Terminal Illness Benefit**: This benefit is available only with the **Life Secure** and **Life Secure with Return of Premium** plan options.

5. **Return of Premium on Maturity**: If the **Life Secure with Return of Premium** option is chosen, the additional premium for the opted coverage options will be returned as part of the Sum Assured on maturity, provided the policy is in-force until the end of the policy term, even if the coverage benefit is utilized during the policy term.

death_benefit_payment_option.value:
1. The **Death Benefit Payout Options** available under the iSelect Smart360 Term Plan are as follows:

 a. **Lump Sum**: The entire benefit is paid out as a one-time lump sum, providing immediate financial support to the family.

 b. **Monthly Income**: The benefit is paid out as a monthly income, which can be either level or increasing at a rate of 5% or 10% per annum (simple interest).

 c. **Part Lump Sum and Part Monthly Income**: A combination of lump sum and monthly income can be chosen, with the proportions available as follows:
   - 25% Lump Sum / 75% Monthly Income
   - 50% Lump Sum / 50% Monthly Income
   - 75% Lump Sum / 25% Monthly Income

2. The **Monthly Income** option is payable for a duration of 60 months.

3. The **Death Benefit Payout Options** cannot be changed once the policy has been issued, and the choice must be made at the inception of the policy.

death_benefits.value:
1. The **Sum Assured on Death** for the policy is the highest of the following:

 a. **11 times the Annualised Premium** or **10 times the Single Premium** (as applicable)

 b. **105% of Total Premiums Paid** as on the date of death in respect of the base Death Benefit provided to the Life Assured.

2. The policy offers three **Plan Options**:

 a. **Life Secure**: Provides coverage until the age of 99 years.

 b. **Life Secure with Income**: Includes a Monthly Survival Income starting from the Policy Anniversary coinciding with or following the Life Assured attaining age 60 years, continuing until the end of the Policy Term or the death of the Life Assured, whichever is earlier.

 c. **Life Secure with Return of Premium**: Also provides coverage until the age of 99 years, with specific benefits upon death during the Policy Term.

surrender_benefits.value:
1. **Guaranteed Surrender Value (GSV)**:  
   a. The policy acquires a GSV after payment of at least the first 2 consecutive Policy Years' Premiums.  
   b. The GSV is calculated as:  
      - B * Total Premiums Paid less cumulative Survival Monthly Income already paid, (if any).  
   c. Factor B is guaranteed for the entire Policy Term.  
   d. For details on Factor B, refer to the sample policy contract available on the Company’s website.  

2. **Special Surrender Value (SSV)**:  
   a. The policy acquires an SSV after completion of the first policy year, provided one full Policy Year’s Premium has been received by the Company.  
   b. The SSV is calculated as:  
      - C * [Monthly Survival Income * 12 * (Maturity Age – 60) * Reduced Paid-up Factor less cumulative Monthly Survival Income already paid, (if any)] + (D * Sum Assured on 2 consecutive Policy Years' Premiums).  
   c. The SSV is also calculated as:  
      - C * Sum Assured on Maturity * Reduced Paid-up Factor + (D * Sum Assured on Death + E * ADB Sum Assured + F * ATPD Sum Assured + H * TI Sum Assured) * Reduced Paid-up Factor.  
   d. The Reduced Paid-up Factor is defined as the Total period for which premiums have already been paid divided by the Total period for which premiums are payable during the Policy Term.  
   e. For details on Factors C to H, refer to the sample policy contract available on the Company’s website.  

3. **Unexpired Risk Premium**:  
   Not available  

4. **Exit Options**:  
   Not available

paid_up_value.value:
1. **Paid-up Sum Assured on Maturity**: 
   a. Upon survival of the Life Assured till the end of the Policy Term, the **Paid-up Sum Assured on Maturity** shall be paid in lump sum as **Maturity Benefit** and the Policy will terminate on payment of this benefit.

2. **Paid-up Sum Assured on Death**: 
   a. In the event of death, the **Paid-up Sum Assured on Death** is defined as the **Reduced Paid-up Factor** multiplied by the higher of (11 times the Annualised Premium and Sum Assured as on the date the Policy becomes Paid-up).
   b. The calculation includes cumulative Monthly Survival Income already paid (if any) plus additional benefits from Accidental Death Benefit (ADB), Waiver of future premium benefit (ATPD), and Total and Permanent Disability (TI) benefits, all adjusted by the **Reduced Paid-up Factor**.

3. **Surrender Value**: 
   a. The Policy acquires a **Guaranteed Surrender Value (GSV)** after payment of at least the first 2 consecutive Policy Years' Premiums. The **Surrender Value** will be the higher of GSV and **Special Surrender Value (SSV)**, subject to a maximum of 100% of Total Premiums Paid.

exit_options.value: Special Exit Value benefit is available under the iSelect Smart360 Term Plan, which allows the Policyholder to receive the Total Premiums Paid (excluding underwriting extra premiums and premiums for Optional In-Built Covers) upon surrendering the Policy under specific conditions. The conditions for availing this benefit are as follows:
exit_options.description: Exit values/options/benefits available for the policy
chunks:
Under this Plan Op�on, a Special Exit Value beneﬁt is available wherein the 
Policyholder shall be returned the Total Premiums Paid, excluding the underwri�ng 
extra premiums and premiums paid for the Op�onal In-Built Covers (if any), if the 
Policyholder surrenders his/her Policy at the earlier of the following:
• the period when the a�ained age of the Life Assured is 65 years (age last 
birthday); or 
• ‘x’ Policy Year (where x is deﬁned as the 25 th Policy Year for Policy Term from 40 
years to 44 years and the 30th Policy Year for Policy Terms greater than 44 years).
Following condi�ons shall be applicable for exercising Special Exit Value beneﬁt: 
• The Policy has to be in-force at the �me of availing this beneﬁt.  
• This beneﬁt is not available for Policy Terms less than 40 years or where the 
Maturity Age is more than 85 years. 
• This beneﬁt is not available on the Policy where Spouse coverage 
is applicable.

been waived-oﬀ.
• The Policy will terminate a�er payment of this beneﬁt. If any Op�onal In-Built 
Covers have been chosen, their Early Exit Value or Surrender Value (as 
applicable), will be paid and their coverage will terminate.
No Special Exit Value is available under these Plan op�ons.

KEY TERMS & CONDITIONS 
1. Collec�on of advance premium shall be allowed within the same ﬁnancial year for the premium due in that ﬁnancial year. 
However, where the premium due in a ﬁnancial year is being collected in previous ﬁnancial year, the premium may be

exit_option_conditions.value:
1. **Special Exit Value Benefit**:  
   a. The Policyholder shall be returned the Total Premiums Paid, excluding underwriting extra premiums and premiums paid for Optional In-Built Covers, if the Policyholder surrenders the Policy at the earlier of:  
      i. The period when the attained age of the Life Assured is 65 years (age last birthday); or  
      ii. ‘x’ Policy Year (where x is defined as the 25th Policy Year for Policy Term from 40 years to 44 years and the 30th Policy Year for Policy Terms greater than 44 years).  

2. **Conditions for Exercising Special Exit Value Benefit**:  
   a. The Policy must be in-force at the time of availing this benefit.  
   b. This benefit is not available for Policy Terms less than 40 years or where the Maturity Age is more than 85 years.  
   c. This benefit is not available on the Policy where Spouse coverage is applicable.  

3. **Grace Period**:  
   a. The grace period will be for 30 days for Annual/Semi-annual/Quarterly modes and 15 days for Monthly mode of premium frequency.  
   b. During this Grace Period, the Policy is considered to be in-force with the risk cover.  
   c. If Death/Accidental Total & Permanent Disability/Terminal Illness occurs during the grace period, the corresponding benefits will be payable after deducting the due unpaid Premium.  

4. **Revival Period**:  
   a. A period of 5 years from the due date of the first unpaid premium during which the Policy can be revived.  

5. **Early Exit Value**:  
   a. The Early Exit Value payable for each life, in respect of each benefit (where the same is in-force) shall be calculated separately.  
   b. The calculation is based on:  
      i. A x Premiums Paid x [Unexpired Term/Policy Term]  
      ii. Premiums Paid, Unexpired Term, and Policy Term shall be as applicable for a given benefit for a given life.  
      iii. Factor A varies by Premium Payment Term and the number of complete years of premiums paid.

Policyholder surrenders his/her Policy at the earlier of the following:
• the period when the a�ained age of the Life Assured is 65 years (age last 
birthday); or 
• ‘x’ Policy Year (where x is deﬁned as the 25 th Policy Year for Policy Term from 40 
years to 44 years and the 30th Policy Year for Policy Terms greater than 44 years).
Following condi�ons shall be applicable for exercising Special Exit Value beneﬁt: 
• The Policy has to be in-force at the �me of availing this beneﬁt.  
• This beneﬁt is not available for Policy Terms less than 40 years or where the 
Maturity Age is more than 85 years. 
• This beneﬁt is not available on the Policy where Spouse coverage 
is applicable.

Key Terms:
Grace Period: The grace period will be for 30 days for Annual/Semi-annual/Quarterly modes and 15 days for Monthly mode 
of premium frequency. During this Grace Period, the Policy is considered to be in-force with the risk cover. If 
Death/Accidental Total & Permanent Disability/Terminal Illness occurs during the grace period, the corresponding beneﬁts 
will be payable a�er deduc�ng the due unpaid Premium. 
Revival Period: A period of 5 years from the due date of the ﬁrst unpaid premium during which the Policy can be revived.
Early Exit Value: The Early Exit Value payable for each life, in respect of each beneﬁt (where the same is in-force) shall be 
calculated separately as detailed below:
A x Premiums Paid x [Unexpired Term/Policy Term]
  Premiums Paid, Unexpired Term and Policy Term shall be as applicable for a given beneﬁt for a given life. 
  Factor A varies by Premium Payment Term and the number of complete years’ of premiums paid.

A discount will be given on the premium rate pertaining to Death beneﬁt for the

Premium Payment op�on) and 2.5% on Single Premium Payment op�on.

In-built Covers can be chosen independently from the Sum Assured opted under the base Plan Option at inception but cannot be more than 
the same.
-  For Block Your Premium option, the Policy Term of the base Death Beneﬁt should be more than or equal to 10 years.
Note: Loyalty Discount cannot be clubbed with Salaried Discount and vice versa.

discount_female.value:
1. **Discount for Female Lives:**  
   a. If the Life Assured or the Spouse of the Life Assured is a **female**, a **3 years age set back** shall be used on **Death rates**.  

2. **Spouse Coverage Discount:**  
   a. A discount will be given on the **premium rate** pertaining to **Death benefit** for the **Spouse** if you choose to opt for **Spouse coverage** under the same policy.

discount_existing_customers.value:
1. **Loyalty Discount:**  
   a. Existing customers with an individual policy of the Company that is in-force at the time of buying this plan will receive a **5% discount** on the first year premium for Regular/Limited Premium Payment option.  
   b. For Single Premium Payment option, a **2.5% discount** will be applied.  

2. **Spouse Coverage Discount:**  
   a. A discount will be provided on the premium rate pertaining to the Death benefit for the Spouse if Spouse coverage is opted under the same policy.  

3. **Female Lives Discount:**  
   a. If the Life Assured or the Spouse of the Life Assured is a female, a **3 years age set back** will be used on Death rates.

discount_salaried.value:
1. **Salaried Customer Discount**: 
   a. A discount of **5%** on the first year premium is available for Regular/Limited Premium Payment option. 
   b. A discount of **2.5%** on the first year premium is available for Single Premium Payment option. 

2. **Eligibility**: 
   a. The discount is applicable if you are a **Salaried customer** as defined in the Company’s BAUP at the time of buying this plan. 

3. **Note**: 
   a. The **Salaried Discount** cannot be clubbed with the **Loyalty Discount** and vice versa.
